name: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
description:
While there is a milestone to honor — and a new section in the book on Why Milestones Are Important — maintaining the original content demonstrates that this book has genuinely weathered the test of time. The book's sidebars (which were updated for the 20th anniversary edition) have been updated again, but the core principles that parents and grandparents embraced 25 years ago are now being shared with new generations who have discovered that its timeless wisdom and no-nonsense lessons can be applied to anyone's life and their vision for a future that includes taking control of their finances.

Milestones are celebrated by people from many cultures and regions. We use them to track time, track progress, reflect on lessons gained, and celebrate achievements... They provide purpose to our life's journey. They are a means for us to merge the past, present, and future... looking back at where we started, where we are now, and the hope of what the future can bring.

So much has changed in our world in the quarter century since Rich Dad Poor Dad was originally published - 25 years since April 8, 1997. But one thing has remained constant: the critical need of financial education. Whether we like it or not, money is still an important part of our lives, and technology has brought both speed and creativity to the realm of money. In an ever-changing environment, we can all grow smarter about money... and learn everything we can to ensure our future.

name: The Power of One More: The Ultimate Guide to Happiness and Success
author: Ed Mylett
description:
Ed Mylett, a famous keynote speaker and performance specialist, draws on 30 years of experience as an entrepreneur and coach to top athletes, entertainers, and business leaders in The Power of One More to uncover effective tactics to help you live an outstanding "one more" life.

In The Power of One More, you'll:

-Discover why you're closer to your aspirations and objectives than you believe, and how The Power of One More tactics can help you cross the finish line in whichever race you're running.
-Learn the psychology and science of using The Power of One More in all aspects of your life to solve issues and achieve levels of achievement you never imagined imaginable.
-Discover time-tested and one-of-a-kind answers to problems that can help you overcome the mental obstacles you've been facing for years.

The Power of One More is an invaluable roadmap to attaining and exceeding your personal and professional objectives by tapping into the superpowers and abilities you already have inside you. It is ideal for anybody who desires more joy, riches, or better relationships."

name: Stop Overthinking
author: Nick Trenton
description:
The most common source of misery is overthinking. Don't get caught up in a never-ending mental cycle. Stay in the now and keep your attention off things that don't and never will.
\Stop Overthinking is a book that knows where you've been, the grueling position you've placed yourself in, and how you become lost in the trap of worry and tension. Nick Trenton, acclaimed author, will guide you through the challenges with thorough and proven ways to help you rewire your brain, regulate your thoughts, and modify your mental habits. Furthermore, the book will teach you scientific methods for radically changing the way you think and feel about yourself by breaking the destructive thinking patterns.

Nick Trenton grew up on a farm in rural Illinois and is a true farm kid. Growing up, his dearest pal was his dachshund companion Leonard. Leonard, rest in peace. He eventually made it off the farm, earning a BS in Economics and an MA in Behavioral Psychology.

How to Recognize and Manage Your Negative Spiral Triggers -How to maintain a focus on relaxation and activity -Tried-and-true ways for overcoming stress attacks-Learn how to cleanse your thoughts and rediscover concentration

There will be no more self-deprecation. There will be no more restless evenings with rushing thoughts. Stop overthinking and achieve more, feel better, and realize your full potential. Finally, you'll be able to live in the present.

name: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description:
Millions of individuals have adopted the 7 Habits and incorporate them into their daily lives. Why? Because they are effective!

The wisdom of the 7 Habits will be renewed for a new generation of leaders with Sean Covey's added lessons on how the habits might be employed in our current world.

They include:
Habit 1: Be Proactive
Habit 2: Begin with the End in Mind
Habit 3: Put First Things First
Habit 4: Think Win/Win
Habit 5: Seek First to Understand, Then to Be Understood
Habit 6: Synergize
Habit 7: Sharpen the Saw

This well-known classic offers a principle-centered approach to dealing with both personal and professional issues. Stephen R. Covey shows a step-by-step approach for living with justice, integrity, honesty, and human dignity—principles that give us the stability to adapt to change and the knowledge and capacity to capitalize on the possibilities that change provides.

name: Think and Grow Rich
author: Napoleon Hill
description:
Think and Grow Rich has been referred to be the "Grandfather of All Motivational Literature." It was the first book to address the provocative question, "What makes a winner?" Napoleon Hill, the guy who asked and waited for the response, is now regarded as one of the world's greatest victors.
The most famous of all success gurus spent "a fortune and the best part of a lifetime of labor" developing the "Law of Success" theory that underpins his books and is so succinctly described in this one.

Hill uses anecdotes from Andrew Carnegie, Thomas Edison, Henry Ford, and other millionaires of his period to illustrate his concepts in the original Think and Grow Rich, published in 1937. Arthur R. Pell, Ph.D., a nationally known author, lecturer, and consultant in human resources management and an expert in applying Hill's thought, deftly interweaves anecdotes of how contemporary millionaires and billionaires, such as Bill Gates, Mary Kay Ash, Dave Thomas, and Sir John Templeton, attained their wealth in the updated version. To avoid stumbling barriers for a new generation of readers, outdated or esoteric vocabulary and examples are carefully revised.

name: Bofuri: I Don't Want to Get Hurt, so I'll Max Out My Defense - Vol. 6
author: Yuumikon
description: Between easily beating the fifth stratum's secret boss and keeping pace with the best players in the game, Maple continues to demonstrate exactly how broken she is. Unfortunately, things aren't going as smoothly for Sally because the sixth stratum's debut reveals a horror-themed level, meaning it's chock-full of ghosts, geists, and ghouls! Wanting to do something nice for her partner who's too terrified to even step onto the new map, Maple sets out to find presents in the haunted houses and cursed crypts, much to the horror of the admins...

name: In Another World With My Smartphone - Vol. 26
author: Patora Fuyuhara
description: With eight children in tow,Touya's got no shortage of distractions! But he has a kingdom to run, and he can't let familial fuss keep him away from his civic duties! As issues both domestic and international pile up, how will Touya cope with the burdens of rulership with nearly two handfuls of obstinate offspring to worry about? And what of the wicked devout, who continue their malicious machinations beneath the cover of night? How many new members have they rallied to their cause, and what might they finally unleash upon unsuspecting nations in the far west? Find out in another exciting tale of swords, sorcery, and flashback episodes!

name: Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation - Vol. 18
author: Rifujin na Magonote
description: In the years since Ariel took the throne, Rudeus has been keeping busy carrying out missions for Orsted and even finding time to save an old friend from slave traders. Then a letter arrives from the Doldia Village, seeking his help with the Sacred Beast's shocking disappearance! Can Rudeus explain his unintended dognapping? Or is he about to have yet another diplomatic incident on his hands?

name: Rascal Does Not Dream of a Sister Venturing Out - Vol. 8
author: Hazime Kamosida
description: After a draining December, Sakuta is quickly nearing the end of his second year of high school. Since Mai is a third-year student, they don't have much time left together before graduation rolls around. Meanwhile, his sister, Kaede, is slowly but steadily venturing outdoors again. Just as she begins to find her footing, she announces her most ambitious goal yet—attending her brother's high school! Sakuta knows better than anyone how difficult this will be for Kaede, and he's ready to support her however he can. He's just not sure if that's what's best for her…or what she really wants…

name: Sword Art Online Progressive - Vol. 1
author: Reki Kawahara
description:
There's no way to beat this game. The only difference is when and where you die..."
One month has passed since Akihiko Kayaba's deadly game began, and the body count continues to rise. Two thousand players are already dead.

Kirito and Asuna are two very different people, but they both desire to fight alone. Nonetheless, they find themselves drawn together to face challenges from both within and without. Given that the entire virtual world they now live in has been created as a deathtrap, the surviving players of Sword Art Online are starting to get desperate, and desperation makes them dangerous to loners like Kirito and Asuna. As it becomes clear that solitude equals suicide, will the two be able to overcome their differences to find the strength to believe in each other, and in so doing survive?

name: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
description:
Lowen Ashleigh is a poor writer on the verge of bankruptcy when she takes the job of a lifetime. Jeremy Crawford, popular novelist Verity Crawford's husband, has hired Lowen to finish the remaining novels in a lucrative series that his wounded wife is unable to complete.

Lowen comes at the Crawford residence, eager to sift through years of Verity's notes and outlines in the hopes of finding enough material to get her started. What Lowen does not expect to find in the shambles of Verity's office is an unfinished autobiography that Verity never meant for anybody to read. Page after page of disturbing revelations, including Verity's remembrance of the night her family's lives were permanently changed.

Lowen chooses to withhold the book from Jeremy, knowing that its contents may be devastating to the already bereaved parent. But as Lowen's feelings for Jeremy become stronger, she realizes how much she would benefit if he read his wife's comments. After all, no matter how much Jeremy loves his damaged wife, this knowledge would make it difficult for him to continue loving her.

name: The Perfect Marriage
author: Ashley Flowers
description: Sarah Morgan is a prominent and successful defense attorney in Washington, D.C. Life is going just as expected for her as a named partner at her firm. Adam, her spouse, cannot be considered to be the same. He's a struggling writer who hasn't had much success in his business, and he's sick of his and Sarah's relationship since she's always working.\n\nAdam had a passionate affair with Kelly Summers at the couple's lake home in the lonely woods. But everything changes one morning. Kelly is found brutally stabbed to death, and Sarah is now faced with her most difficult case yet: defending her own husband, who is suspected of murdering his lover.

name: Pen Pal
author: J.T. Geissinger
description:
The first letter arrived on the day my spouse was laid to rest. It was addressed to the state prison and contained only one sentence:
I'll wait indefinitely if necessary.

It was signed by Dante, a man I had never met.

I replied back out of curiosity to find out what he was waiting for. His response?

You.

I informed the mysterious man that he had the incorrect female. He stated that he did not. I said we'd never met, but he corrected me.

We corresponded weekly, sharing letters that got increasingly personal. The letters then ceased one day. It was too late when I discovered why.

Dante had arrived at my door.

Nothing on this planet could have prepared me for what occurred next.

name: Rich Blood
author: Robert Bailey
description:
Attorney Jason Rich has built a fortune off of the misfortunes of others. "In an accident?" reads his billboard. "Get Rich!"—accompanies travellers from Alabama to Florida on roads. He's a standout among ambulance chasers.

However, Jason has hit a difficult patch following a recent divorce and a term in recovery. And things only become worse when his sister, Jana, is suspected of murdering her husband. Jana asks Jason to represent her despite the fact that he has no expertise in criminal court.

Jason feels conflicted about returning to Lake Guntersville, Alabama, and even more so about re-entering his sister's life. Jana has a lot of enemies around town, thanks to the drugs, the affairs, and her penchant to gaslight everyone in her tight circle.

But did Jana hire someone to assassinate her husband? Jason isn't convinced. He returns to his village to uncover the truth and face combat against old and new foes.

name: Twenty Years Later
author: Charlie Donlea
description:
Avery Mason, the host of American Events, understands what topics pique the interest of a television audience. Her most recent narrative, a murder mystery packed with kinky sex, heartbreak, and treachery, is sure to be a ratings hit. New DNA testing has enabled the New York Medical Examiner's Office to successfully identify a 9/11 victim for the first time in years. The twist: the victim, Victoria Ford, was charged with the heinous murder of her married boyfriend. Victoria implored her sister to prove her innocence in a terrifying final phone chat.

Emma Kind has waited twenty years to lay her sister to rest, but she won't be able to do so until Victoria's name is cleared. She's had little luck on her own, but she's confident that Avery's connections and celebrity would help. Avery goes into investigative overdrive in order to secure a more lucrative network deal. Victoria had an affair with a prominent author who was discovered hanging from the balcony of his Catskills estate. Victoria's DNA was found on the rope, the bedroom, and the whole crime scene.

But the tangled web of Victoria's personal life is only the beginning. And Avery is unaware that there are other participants in the game who are interested in Avery's own hidden past—one she has kept concealed from both network executives and her television audience. A secret she believed was long gone...

name: It Ends with Us
author: Colleen Hoover
description:
Lily hasn't always had it easy, but that's never stopped her from working hard for the life she wants. She's come a long way from the small town where she grew up—she graduated from college, moved to Boston, and started her own business. And when she feels a spark with a gorgeous neurosurgeon named Ryle Kincaid, everything in Lily's life seems too good to be true.

Ryle is assertive, stubborn, maybe even a little arrogant. He's also sensitive, brilliant, and has a total soft spot for Lily. And the way he looks in scrubs certainly doesn't hurt. Lily can't get him out of her head. But Ryle's complete aversion to relationships is disturbing. Even as Lily finds herself becoming the exception to his “no dating” rule, she can't help but wonder what made him that way in the first place.

As questions about her new relationship overwhelm her, so do thoughts of Atlas Corrigan—her first love and a link to the past she left behind. He was her kindred spirit, her protector. When Atlas suddenly reappears, everything Lily has built with Ryle is threatened.

name: The Good Luck Charm
author: Helena Hunting
description: Lilah isn't sure what hurt worse: the day Ethan left her to focus on his hockey career or the day he came back eight years later. He might think they can pick up just where they left off, but she's no longer that same girl and never wants to be again.\nEthan wants his glory days back. And that includes having Lilah by his side. With her, he was magic. They were magic. All he has to do is make her see that.\nJust when Lilah might finally be ready to let Ethan in, though, she finds out their reunion might have nothing to do with love and everything to do with improving his game. But Ethan's already lost her once, and even if it costs him his career, he'll do anything to keep from losing her again.

name: The Love Hypothesis Paperback
author: Ali Hazelwood
description:
As a third-year Ph.D. candidate, Olive Smith doesn't believe in lasting romantic relationships--but her best friend does, and that's what got her into this situation. Convincing Anh that Olive is dating and well on her way to a happily ever after was always going to take more than hand-wavy Jedi mind tricks: Scientists require proof. So, like any self-respecting biologist, Olive panics and kisses the first man she sees.

That man is none other than Adam Carlsen, a young hotshot professor--and well-known ass. Which is why Olive is positively floored when Stanford's reigning lab tyrant agrees to keep her charade a secret and be her fake boyfriend. But when a big science conference goes haywire, putting Olive's career on the Bunsen burner, Adam surprises her again with his unyielding support and even more unyielding...six-pack abs.

Suddenly their little experiment feels dangerously close to combustion. And Olive discovers that the only thing more complicated than a hypothesis on love is putting her own heart under the microscope.

name: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description:
Aging and reclusive Hollywood movie icon Evelyn Hugo is finally ready to tell the truth about her glamorous and scandalous life. But when she chooses unknown magazine reporter Monique Grant for the job, no one is more astounded than Monique herself. Why her? Why now?

Monique is not exactly on top of the world. Her husband has left her, and her professional life is going nowhere. Regardless of why Evelyn has selected her to write her biography, Monique is determined to use this opportunity to jumpstart her career.

Summoned to Evelyn’s luxurious apartment, Monique listens in fascination as the actress tells her story. From making her way to Los Angeles in the 1950s to her decision to leave show business in the '80s, and, of course, the seven husbands along the way, Evelyn unspools a tale of ruthless ambition, unexpected friendship, and a great forbidden love. Monique begins to feel a very real connection to the legendary star, but as Evelyn’s story near its conclusion, it becomes clear that her life intersects with Monique’s own in tragic and irreversible ways.

name: The Singles Table
author: Sara Desal
description:
After a devastating break-up, celebrity-obsessed lawyer Zara Patel is determined never to open her heart again. She puts her energy into building her career and helping her friends find their happily-ever-afters. She's never faced a guest at the singles table she couldn’t match, until she crosses paths with the sinfully sexy Jay Dayal.

Former military security specialist Jay has no time for love. His life is about working hard, staying focused, and winning at all costs. When charismatic Zara crashes into his life, he's thrown into close contact with exactly the kind of chaos he wants to avoid. Worse, they're stuck together for the entire wedding season.

So they make a deal. She'll find his special someone if he introduces her to his celebrity clients. But when their arrangement brings them together in ways they never expected, they realize that the perfect match might just be their own.

name: test
author: test
description: test
